text: Károly Palotai (11 September 1935 – 3 February 2018) was a Hungarian association football player and referee. He was an Olympic Gold winner as a player before turning to refereeing. He was a referee at three World Cup tournaments and officiated in two European Cup finals. He also served as an official referee for FIFA. Palotai died in Budapest on 3 February 2018 of a stroke at the age of 82.Gyász: 82 éves korában elhunyt Palotai Károly ==References== ==Other websites== *Referee profile on worldfootball.net Category:1935 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Hungarian footballers Category:Olympic gold medalists for Hungary Category:Association football referees
title: Károly Palotai
